title: Behind Powell’s Big Gamble in Final Jackson Hole Speech
description: Jerome Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, is managing a high-stakes balancing act as he grapples with a cooling labor market, rising inflation and White House pressure to cut interest rates.

description.name: description
description.value: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, outside the Jackson Hole Economic Symposium in Wyoming last year.

title: Investors Expect Nvidia’s Earnings to Move the S&P More Than Powell’s Speech
description: When Nvidia, the chip producer, reports earnings next week, investors expect the S&P 500 to have a bigger reaction than when the Fed chair delivers a big speech on Friday.

credit.name: credit
credit.value: Mike Kai Chen for The New York Times

description.name: description
description.value: Nvidia has grown with the rise of artificial intelligence, and it now makes up almost 8 percent of the S&P 500.

title: Walmart Sees Sales ‘Momentum’ Despite Tariffs
description: After mixed reports from retail rivals, Walmart reported better-than-expected quarterly results and raised its sales forecast for the year.

credit.name: credit
credit.value: Karsten Moran for The New York Times

description.name: description
description.value: Shoppers outside of a Walmart Supercenter in Teterboro, N.J. As the nation’s largest retailer, Walmart is considered a bellwether for the state of the consumer.

title: Israel’s Looming Plans for Gaza City, and a Surge in Stalking in Women’s Sports
description: Plus, why steamy fan fiction is topping the best-seller list.

author.name: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Jonah E. Bromwich

authors.name: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Jonah E. Bromwich

creator: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Jonah E. Bromwich

creator.name: creator
creator.value: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Jonah E. Bromwich

description.name: description
description.value: Rushing for cover after an Israeli strike in Jabaliya, in northern Gaza, on Wednesday. Israel’s plan to invade Gaza City has forced many families to consider uprooting themselves.

title: A Giant Wyeth Mural Comes Out of the Vault, Bearing Family Stories
description: N.C. Wyeth’s colossal 1932 mural, “Apotheosis of the Family,” re-emerges in a gleaming new round barn after years in storage.

credit.name: credit
credit.value: Caroline Gutman for The New York Times

title: Texas and California Race Forward With Rival Redistricting Efforts
description: Lawmakers in the nation’s two most populous states were planning to vote Thursday on competing proposals as the battle over U.S. House maps intensified.

description.name: description
description.value: Todd Hunter, a Republican state representative in Texas, with fellow Republican members of the State House of Representatives during a session at the Capitol in Austin on Wednesday.

title: Obama Endorses Newsom’s Redistricting Proposal as a ‘Responsible Approach’
description: The former president suggested that Democrats opposing G.O.P. efforts in Texas and elsewhere should advance their own gerrymandering plans.

description.name: description
description.value: Former President Barack Obama last year. Gov. Gavin Newsom’s approach to redistricting, he said, is “designed to address a very particular problem in a very particular moment in time.”

title: Adams Adviser Suspended From Campaign After Giving Cash to Reporter
description: A campaign volunteer for Mayor Eric Adams of New York was suspended after giving a journalist cash in a potato chip bag.

author.name: Bianca Pallaro, Jay Root and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

authors.name: Bianca Pallaro, Jay Root and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

creator: Bianca Pallaro, Jay Root and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

creator.name: creator
creator.value: Bianca Pallaro, Jay Root and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

credit.name: credit
credit.value: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

description.name: description
description.value: Winnie Greco was the mayor’s former director of Asian affairs at City Hall and one of his best fund-raisers.

title: What to Know About Corruption Investigations Surrounding Eric Adams
description: Months after a federal corruption indictment against Mayor Eric Adams of New York was dropped, some of his allies remain under investigation or have been charged with crimes.
categories: Eric Adams Federal Corruption Case (24 CR 556)

title: Mamdani, Skeptical of Casinos, Won’t Try to Block Them in New York City
description: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic mayoral nominee, said that while he still had doubts about city casinos, he respected the views of voters who supported them.

description.name: description
description.value: Zohran Mamdani made his remarks after a rally with the Hotel and Gaming Trades Council, a union that endorsed Mr. Mamdani after his primary win and strongly backs the gambling expansion.

title: Ukraine Works to Identify 6,000 Bodies Sent From Russia in Makeshift Rail Platform Lab
description: The mass return of fallen soldiers is one of the few concrete results of U.S.-orchestrated truce negotiations.

title: Zelensky Says U.S. Talks Brought ‘Very Important’ Advance
description: The Ukrainian leader returned with a U.S. commitment to participate in security guarantees for Kyiv in a postwar settlement.

description.name: description
description.value: President Trump with President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine at the White House on Monday. The meeting was different than their last one.

title: Rubio Takes on Tricky Task of Drafting Security Guarantees for Ukraine
description: The secretary of state and national security adviser will meet with European counterparts on Thursday in an effort to advance a peace process that so far has gotten little traction.

description.name: description
description.value: Secretary of State Marco Rubio, right, speaking with Russia’s foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, during a joint news conference in Anchorage, where President Trump and President Vladimir V. Putin met for a summit on Friday.

title: Gazans Fear Looming Israeli Operation
description: Israel’s plan to invade Gaza City, the most populous city in the northern Gaza Strip, has forced many families to consider uprooting themselves.

description.name: description
description.value: An Israeli strike hits a building on Wednesday in Jabaliya in the northern Gaza Strip.

title: Israel’s Operation to Take Control of Gaza City Looms. Where Does It Stand?
description: The Israeli government is expanding its operation in Gaza, despite its generals’ advice and as it deliberates on a new cease-fire proposal.

description.name: description
description.value: An Israeli armored fighting vehicle near the border with Gaza earlier this month.

title: With Moves on West Bank and Gaza City, Israel Defies Global Outcry
description: Israel approved new settlements in the occupied West Bank, while its troops have reached the outskirts of Gaza City. The developments raise questions about the viability of a cease-fire proposal.

description.name: description
description.value: An Israeli military vehicle on Israel’s side of the border with Gaza on Tuesday.

title: ‘A Soundtrack of Skating’ Let the Tony Hawk Games Soar
description: The hip-hop, punk and nu-metal tracks on Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 2 helped imprint memories like nosegrinding a helicopter.

credit.name: credit
credit.value: Photo illustration by The New York Times

title: The Menendez Brothers Make Their Case for Parole
description: The two will have separate hearings, and it is not at all certain that the outcome will be the same for each man.

description.name: description
description.value: Lyle, left, and Erik Menendez in Beverly Hills Municipal Court in 1990.

title: As Menendez Brothers Seek Parole, a New Tour Visits the Crime Scene
description: As Erik and Lyle Menendez wait for a ruling on their parole, a new tour is retelling their story, in detail, from the back of a limousine.

credit.name: credit
credit.value: Jamie Lee Taete for The New York Times

title: Why Shop? In Maine, the Library of Things Has It All (Almost)
description: One town’s effort to make pricey items accessible and encourage people to buy less stuff seems to be catching on.

author.name: Cara Buckley and Ryan David Brown

authors.name: Cara Buckley and Ryan David Brown
